case_vignette: A 30 YEAR OLD MALE IS ADMITTED TO THE HOSPITAL FOR A RASH THAT DEVELOPED ON THE CHEST AND THEN SPREAD ACROSS THE BACK, FACE, AND LEGS. HE RECENTLY STARTED LAMOTRIGINE TWO WEEKS AGO FOR SEIZURE PREVENTION. HE DENIES ANY OTHER RECENT MEDICATION CHANGES. HE ENDORSES SIGNIFICANT PAIN AT THE SITE OF THE RASH AND ALSO PAIN WITH URINATION.   PHYSICAL EXAMINATION REVEALS DIFFUSE PINK ERYTHEMATOUS PATCHES OF THE CHEST, BACK WITH FEW SCATTERED DUSKY CENTRAL PATCHES AND MULTIPLE BULLAE. APPLYING PRESSURE WITH A FINGER AND MOVING LATERALLY RESULTS IN SEPARATION OF THE SKIN ON MANY AREAS OF THE BACK. ORAL EROSIONS ON THE LIPS AND ON THE GLANS PENIS ARE APPRECIATED.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a painful rash on my chest, back, face, and legs, and I also experience pain when urinating.
Have you noticed any blisters or ulcers in the areas where the rash is present?
Yes, there are multiple blisters on the areas where the rash is present.
Do you recall having any similar symptoms in the past?
No, I haven't had similar symptoms in the past.
How long have you had these symptoms?
I've had these symptoms for about two weeks.
Do you have any known allergies or have you started using any new medications or products recently?
I recently started taking lamotrigine two weeks ago for seizure prevention and have not made any other recent medication changes.
Final Diagnosis: Stevens-Johnson Syndrome

trial_0.summarized_conversation: A patient consults with complaints of a painful rash located on their chest, back, face, and legs. Additionally, the patient reports experiencing pain when urinating. Upon examination, multiple blisters are observed in the areas affected by the rash. The patient notes that these symptoms began approximately two weeks ago and confirms having no prior history of similar symptoms. The onset of the symptoms coincides with the initiation of lamotrigine, started two weeks prior for seizure prevention, without any other recent changes in medication.
